author: Ken Hom
method: If the corn is fresh, cut the kernels off the cob. If using frozen corn, blanch the frozen corn for five seconds in a pan of boiling water and drain. Heat a wok or large sauté pan until hot. Add the oil, salt, corn, and chilies and stir-fry for one minute. Add the pepper, sugar, and chicken stock, and continue to cook for three minutes. Serve at once.
ingredients: 275g/10oz fresh sweetcorn (about 2 ears), or frozen corn  ,  1½ tbsp groundnut or vegetable oil,  salt and freshly ground white pepper, to taste,  2 large red chillies, seeds removed, finely chopped,  1 tsp sugar,  50ml/1¾fl oz vegetarian or chicken stock
